testCases.explanation: Can be decoded as 'AB' (1,2) or 'L' (12). Total: 2 ways.
Can be decoded as 'BZ' (2,26), 'VF' (22,6), or 'BBF' (2,2,6). Total: 3 ways.
'06' cannot be decoded because '0' alone has no mapping and '06' > 26.
Can be decoded as (1,1,10,6) or (11,10,6). Total: 2 ways.
'10' can only be decoded as 'J' (10). Total: 1 way.

description:
Solve the **Decode Ways** problem.

A message encoded with the mapping 'A'->1, 'B'->2, ..., 'Z'->26 is given as a digit string s. Find the total number of ways to decode it.

See the full problem description on [LeetCode](https://leetcode.com/problems/decode-ways/).
